metadata.title: CVE-2022-47940 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in ksmbd in the Linux kernel 5.15 through 5.18before 5.18.18. fs/ksmbd/smb2pdu.c lacks length validation in thenon-padding case in smb2_write.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-47940` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-60-generic - 5.15.0-60.66
linux-image-5.15.0-60-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-60.66
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-60-generic - 5.15.0-60.66
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-60-generic-64k - 5.15.0-60.66
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1028-kvm - 5.15.0-1028.33
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1030-aws - 5.15.0-1030.34
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1033-azure - 5.15.0-1033.40
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1025-intel-iotg - 5.15.0-1025.30
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-60-lowlatency - 5.15.0-60.66
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-60-lowlatency-64k - 5.15.0-60.66
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1029-oracle - 5.15.0-1029.35
No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-5.15.0-1024-raspi - 5.15.0-1024.26
linux-image-5.15.0-1024-raspi-nolpae - 5.15.0-1024.26
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-60.66').
linux-kvm package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1028.33').
linux-aws package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1030.34').
linux-azure package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1033.40').

linux-gcp package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1029.36').
linux-gke package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1027.32').
linux-gkeop package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1015.19').
linux-ibm package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1025.28').
linux-intel-iotg package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1025.30').
linux-lowlatency package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-60.66').
linux-oracle package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1029.35').
linux-oem-5.17: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-oem-6.1, was needed').
linux-oem-6.0 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.0.0-1006.6').
linux-raspi package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1024.26').
